chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: nat
a: nat

Goal:
bool

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Nat.clearbit = fun a n : nat => Nat.ldiff a (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.clearbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.setbit = fun a n : nat => Nat.lor a (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.setbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise orb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.lor (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.ones = fun n : nat => Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat Arguments Nat.ones _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
VectorDef.map2 : (?A -> ?B -> ?C) -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> VectorDef.t ?C n where ?A : [a : nat b : nat |- Type] ?B : [a : nat b : nat |- Type] ?C : [a : nat b : nat |- Type]
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.ltb = fun n m : nat => S n <=? m : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.ltb (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
VectorDef.nth_order : VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> forall p : nat, p < ?n -> ?A where ?A : [a : nat b : nat |- Type] ?n : [a : nat b : nat |- nat]
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.shiftr = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => Init.Nat.div2) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments Init.Nat.shiftr (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
ltBool = fun a b : nat => let s := le_lt_dec b a in if s then false else true : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments ltBool (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Init.Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.odd _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat := match n with | S (S n') => S (div2 n') | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
VectorDef.const : ?A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n where ?A : [a : nat b : nat |- Type]
BinNatDef.N.shiftr_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => BinNums.N) a (fun _ : nat => BinNatDef.N.div2) : BinNums.N -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => BinNums.N) n Arguments BinNatDef.N.shiftr_nat _%N_scope _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.bitwise = fix bitwise (op : bool -> bool -> bool) (n a b : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => (if op (Init.Nat.odd a) (Init.Nat.odd b) then 1 else 0) + 2 * bitwise op n' (Init.Nat.div2 a) (Init.Nat.div2 b) end : (bool -> bool -> bool) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.bitwise _%function_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.Even = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Even _%nat_scope
Nat.Odd = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m + 1 : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Odd _%nat_scope
Fin.eq_dec : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, {x = y} + {x <> y} where ?n : [a : nat b : nat |- nat]
BinPosDef.Pos.testbit_nat = fix testbit_nat (p : BinNums.positive) : nat -> bool := match p with | BinNums.xI p0 => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => true | S n' => testbit_nat p0 n' end | BinNums.xO p0 => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => false | S n' => testbit_nat p0 n' end | BinNums.xH => fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => true | S _ => false end end : BinNums.positive -> nat -> bool Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.testbit_nat _%positive_scope _%nat_scope
Bvector.Bvector = Vector.t bool : nat -> Set Arguments Bvector.Bvector _%nat_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.size_nat = fix size_nat (p : BinNums.positive) : nat := match p with | BinNums.xI p0 | BinNums.xO p0 => S (size_nat p0) | BinNums.xH => 1 end : BinNums.positive -> nat Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.size_nat _%positive_scope
BinNatDef.N.testbit_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => fun _ : nat => false | BinNums.Npos p => BinPos.Pos.testbit_nat p end : BinNums.N -> nat -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.testbit_nat _%N_scope _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.testbit = fix testbit (a n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => Init.Nat.odd a | S n0 => testbit (Init.Nat.div2 a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.testbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.eqf_equiv = {| RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive := fun (x : nat -> bool) (n : nat) => eq_refl; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : nat -> bool) (H : Nat.eqf x y) (n : nat) => eq_sym (H n); RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : nat -> bool) (H : Nat.eqf x y) (H0 : Nat.eqf y z) (n : nat) => eq_trans (H n) (H0 n) |} : RelationClasses.Equivalence Nat.eqf
EnvRing.PNSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> list (EnvRing.Mon * EnvRing.Pol C) -> nat -> nat -> EnvRing.Pol C
Init.Nat.leb = fix leb (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => true | S n' => match m with | 0 => false | S m' => leb n' m' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.leb (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.b2n = fun b : bool => if b then 1 else 0 : bool -> nat Arguments Nat.b2n _%bool_scope
Ring_polynom.PNSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
PeanoNat.Nat.testbit_wd_obligation_1 = fun (x y : nat) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : nat) (H0 : x0 = y0) => eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => Nat.testbit x x1 = Nat.testbit y y0) (eq_ind_r (fun x1 : nat => Nat.testbit x1 y0 = Nat.testbit y y0) eq_refl H) H0 : Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq eq) Nat.testbit Nat.testbit
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S n)), P n v where ?A : [a : nat b : nat |- Type]
